metadata.title: CVE-2023-28161 on Ubuntu 20.04 LTS (focal) - low
metadata.description:
If temporary "one-time" permissions, such as the ability to use the Camera,were granted to a document loaded using a file: URL, that permissionpersisted in that tab for all other documents loaded from a file: URL. Thisis potentially dangerous if the local files came from different sources,such as in a download directory. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 111.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-28161` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 111.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
firefox-geckodriver - 111.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 111.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '111.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1').
mozjs52: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
mozjs68: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
